title: FDA may soon approve mixing and matching COVID booster shots
text:
The FDA won't recommend any booster over the others but will permit people to get a booster shot that is different from the shot they first received, one of the people familiar with the matter said.

The FDA is trying to greenlight mixing and matching as soon as this week, the people familiar with the matter said. The FDA is also expected to approve Moderna Inc. MRNA and Johnson & Johnson JNJ boosters this week, according to a person familiar with the matter.

The FDA has authorized extra doses of vaccines from Pfizer Inc. PFE and partner BioNTech SE BNTX and from Moderna for people with compromised immune systems. The FDA has also authorized Pfizer-BioNTech boosters for seniors and other people at high-risk of severe illness.

An expanded version of this report appears on WSJ.com.
